name: xlsxio
description: C library for reading values from and writing values to .xlsx files

repo.name: xlsxio
repo.description: XLSX I/O - C library for reading and writing .xlsx files

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and examples for a C library, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and runtime configuration documentation.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section for common errors like file corruption, memory issues, or compatibility problems with different Excel versions

injection_risks.description: User input (argv[i]) is used to open a file without validation, potentially leading to arbitrary file access.
User input (argv[1]) is used to create a file and write data to it without validation, potentially leading to arbitrary file creation and data tampering.

critical_findings: Arbitrary file access and creation vulnerabilities
Lack of input validation and error handling
security.summary: The xlsxio package has several security concerns, including arbitrary file access and creation vulnerabilities, lack of input validation, and inadequate error handling.

common_complaints: Sheet iteration limitations - cannot reliably traverse all sheets in workbooks
DateTime/date handling - Excel serial numbers not converted to readable formats
API design issues - conflicting function behaviors (xlsxioread_sheet_open breaks xlsxioread_sheetlist_next)
Memory safety issues - potential realloc() leaks and segmentation faults
Missing features - no merged cell support, no random cell access by index
Build/dependency issues - minizip vs minizip-ng confusion, 32-bit DLL problems
praise_themes: Project appreciated for existence and functionality
Generally useful for xlsx reading/conversion tasks
sentiment.summary: xlsxio shows signs of slow maintenance with unresolved core functionality bugs, design issues causing user frustration, and critical features like sheet enumeration and datetime handling that have lingered for years without fixes.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are clear, helpful, and patient, with a good level of technical depth and a welcoming tone.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being 4+ months ago
45 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
No merged pull requests in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
Stale issues indicate lack of maintainer engagement
maintenance.summary: The xlsxio package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months and a growing backlog of unresolved issues.

project_metrics.description: XLSX I/O - C library for reading and writing .xlsx files

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and informative, but lacks a clear quick start guide and troubleshooting section.
concerns: Low number of commits in the past six months (only 1)
No merged PRs in the past six months
Docs: Lack of a comprehensive troubleshooting section
Community: Unable to obtain all sheets in xlsx
Community: After using xlsxioread_sheet_open, cannot use xlsxioread_sheetlist_next to get the next sheet
Security: Arbitrary file access and creation vulnerabilities
Security: Lack of input validation and error handling
Security: User input (argv[1]) is used to create a file and write data to it without validation, potentially leading to arbitrary file creation and data tampering.
High bus factor risk (95% from top contributor)
highlights: Recent commit and release dates indicate some level of activity
